body.name: Razer Kiyo Streaming Webcam: 1080p 30 FPS / 720p 60 FPS - Ring Light w/Adjustable Brightness - Built-in Microphone - Advanced Autofocus
body.merchantInfo: Ships from and sold by W Wonder.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 21 hrs 46 mins
features: FULL HD RESOLUTION — Experience crisp, detailed video and audio recording in 720p 60 FPS / 1080p 30 FPS. Works great for streaming, gaming, recording, video calling, conferencing, and online school. Audio Codec: 16 bit 48 KHz
CONVENIENT, BUILT-IN LIGHTING — Features a 5600K daylight-balanced ring light around the camera that provides even lighting without the hassle of additional lighting equipment
ADJUSTABLE BRIGHTNESS — Make quick adjustments to the brightness level by simply rotating the built-in ring light. There's no need to configure software settings
SUPERIOR LOW-LIGHT PERFORMANCE — Reduces graininess and brings out details to show the best light even in darker environments
COMPACT, FOLDING DESIGN — Sleek look for any gaming setup or office, and perfect for on-the-go content creators
COMPATIBILITY — Streamlabs certified and works with popular platforms like OBS, XSplit, Twitch, YouTube, Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Skype
body.description: Designed and tested by top streamers, the Razer Kiyo is a desktop streaming camera with a powerful, multi-step ring light that you can dim or brighten on command, and the ability to stream at 60 fps for full gaming fidelity. It’s the perfect camera for professional streaming. Microphone Sensitivity: -38dB.

Backed by a fast, accurate autofocus and fully customizable settings, it’s your time to shine in professional streaming

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I recently purchased the Razer Kiyo Streaming Webcam, and I must say that it has exceeded my expectations in terms of its performance and features. Whether I'm using it for video conferencing, streaming, or recording videos, this webcam delivers excellent quality and functionality.The video quality of the Razer Kiyo is outstanding. It supports full HD 1080p resolution at 30 frames per second, ensuring sharp and detailed visuals. The camera captures vibrant colors and maintains good clarity, even in low-light conditions. The autofocus feature works seamlessly, ensuring that I always stay in focus during my video calls or streams.One of the standout features of the Kiyo is its built-in ring light. This ring light provides adjustable brightness levels, allowing me to customize the lighting according to my preference. It eliminates shadows and ensures that I'm well-lit, resulting in a professional and polished appearance. The ring light is a game-changer, especially for those who frequently participate in video conferences or live streaming.The Razer Kiyo also comes with a built-in microphone, which delivers clear and crisp audio. While it may not match the quality of dedicated external microphones, it is more than sufficient for everyday use. The convenience of having an integrated microphone saves me from having to set up additional audio equipment, making the Kiyo a practical choice.Setting up the webcam is a breeze. It connects easily via USB and is compatible with a wide range of video conferencing and streaming platforms such as Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Skype. The software provided by Razer allows for further customization, including adjusting video settings, configuring the ring light, and enabling additional features.The build quality of the Razer Kiyo is solid. It feels sturdy and well-made, giving me confidence in its durability. The flexible mount allows for easy positioning and adjustment, ensuring that I can find the perfect angle for my recordings or calls. The compact and sleek design adds to its overall appeal.Overall, I highly recommend the Razer Kiyo Streaming Webcam to anyone in need of a high-quality and versatile camera for video conferencing, streaming, or content creation. Its exceptional video quality, adjustable ring light, and convenient built-in microphone make it a top choice for professionals and enthusiasts alike. With the Razer Kiyo, you can elevate the quality of your video calls and streams, and enjoy a seamless and immersive experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cleanest looking webcam and no UGLY logos!
reviews.reviewText: Great picture quality which is easy to configure using their software. I use this through a kvm switch between a Mac and windows pc and it works flawlessly. You can configure your zoom and picture settings in windows and it saves/carries the settings when using with my MacBook. Additionally there are third party apps which allow full control on the Mac also. I tested a few other cameras but when set this apart was the attractive build with no UGLY branding and build quality. It has soft padding which a tilt feature which is extremely useful for positioning! Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars This camera won me over in the end...after some trial and error
reviews.reviewText: My general Zoom/webcam space is very dark with not a lot of natural light. After bouncing back and forth between the Kiyo Pro and the Kiyo, I decided the cheaper option with the ring light was the best purchasing choice for me. Right out of the box, I was impressing with the compact size and quality of the camera. However, when I plugged it into my computer, my hopes were dashed very quickly.I tried this camera out at about 6 PM in the evening, so the sun had disappeared, leaving me with just the lamp by my computer. I am rarely ever using a webcam at this time, as most of my activity is for meetings during the day. As an avid gamer, I like the Razer brand, which is how I discovered this product in the first place. So, I began my configuration in lighting that I'd rarely ever use (my mistake). However, I did notice some important things.1. The ring light is way too bright if you are using this on a laptop in low light. Since I sit relatively close to my laptop screen, the ring light was a foot or so away from my face, and boy, it was not a pretty sight. I had to move far away from the laptop in order for the lighting to look remotely normal.2. The auto-focus in low-light wasn't that great.So, I moved to another computer (a desktop) in a brighter part of the house and plugged the camera in to see if I was totally out of luck. I was cheered by the fact that the camera looked great in a well-lit area. Great image quality, good reaction time, and the lighting looked wonderful. My hopes were restored! But I can't zoom from my desktop, due to sharing an office space with my partner. I needed to make this work for my laptop desk space.Well, I waited until daylight and reconfigured the camera using the Razer Synapse settings. Although I still had issues with auto-focus and how the ring light interacts with my green screen, the camera picture was much, much better during the daytime. The ring light also isn't as glaringly obvious with natural light helping it along.I'm content enough to keep this webcam because, with the right lighting, the picture/image quality looks great, although if the Kiyo Pro wasn't such a huge price jump, I might be tempted to give it a try to see if the sensor works better than this ring light...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Incredible quality, light makes a huge difference, simple to operate, great for Zoom
reviews.reviewText: I upgraded from a Logitech 720p camera. The Logitech made me look like terrible for reasons I still cant figure out. It was grainy despite being 720p and it highlighted flaws.I thought lighting was the issue and rather than buying a "selfie light", I thought this would be better as it is integrated.It was pretty much plug and play and I can't believe the difference. The light is strong on it, adjustable mechanically by just turning the dial. It has a separate light to show you it's on, so you know when it's on. The quality of the image is super clear, and highlights not the flaws of my face, but the rest of my face. It's not grainy. The autofocus works great.I can't say enough good things about this camera. I know little about Razer, but I'll be keeping an eye out for their other products given how good this is.

SI no eres un influecer está es una buena cámara para cumplir con videollamadas con buena calidad y requiere iluminación donde el entorno no ayuda, sin deslumbrar, ajustable, quizas que se mantuviera con tranquilidad un poco más fija, me da la sensación de que si se mueve el monitor se llegue a caer
Very good webcam, i use it for streaming. Picture quality from it is very good for a webcam.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing when it worked - 1 yr on it's no longer working.
reviews.reviewText: This is a really versatile camera, with brilliant quality, easy to use and I have been able to travel with it and use it for regular video call meetings wherever I am. Unfortunately, 16 months on, the product has started failing. I will be contacting the company to see if I can be sent another, as it's relatively new.
Webcam ist toll. Die beigelegte Software (per Download) ist allerdings sehr gewöhnungsbedürftig.
